valueString:
1. Head:
Specimen received: Fresh
Patient's name on label:  John Breau 
Specimen designation: Posterior scalp mass (permanent)


The specimen consists of an ellipse of skin sitting atop a portion of pink 
tan-yellow soft tissue, weighing 77 g and measuring 8.5 x 5.7 x 3.5 cm.  
The ellipse of skin is tan-white and hairbearing.  It is 9 x 1.4 x 0.4 cm. 
 Beneath the skin ellipse is a 7 x 5.1 x 4.2 cm portion of fibrofatty and 
fibromuscular tissue.  Palpation reveals multiple spherical mobile 
nodules.


The resection margin is inked black.  The specimen is serially sectioned 
to reveal a multi septated mass measuring 5.4 x 4 x 2.5 cm.  The cut 
surfaces of the mass range from clear tan gelatinous to tan-white opaque.  
The entire mass is thickly encapsulated.  The capsule comes within 0.1 cm 
of the overlying dermis (Block A).  The capsule of the mass also abuts the 
inked resection margin. 


The remainder of the specimen is made up of unremarkable fibrofatty 
tissue. Photographs are taken. Representative sections are submitted.


Summary of Sections
------------------------------------
As of: 06/22/19 6:35 PM
------------------------------------
1A - Block - 1 -mass to dermis
1B - Block - 1 -mass with capsule abutting margin
1C - Block - 1 -rep mass
1D - Block - 1 -rep mass with opaque portion
1E - Block - 1 -rep mass to skin
1F - Block - 1 -rep mass with deep margin
1G - Block - 1 -rep uninvolved


Total blocks - 7


Entered by Regina Kwon, MD MPH, 06/22/19 6:12 PM.
